text: in a windswept desert the wreckage of a
plane carrying Russian tourists back
home after a holiday in the Sun the
aircraft apparently broke up in midair
Egyptian officials said the debris was
spread over several square miles the
Egyptian prime minister who visited the
crash scene dismissed claims of a
missile strike by Islamic militants
he said the planes recovered black box
recorders would show what happened but
he thought the most likely cause was
technical difficulty the emergency
ministry in Russia said it was sending
several planes to Egypt overnight one of
them was due to start bringing back the
bodies of the dead buses carrying some
of those Russian personnel have already
been seen leaving Cairo Airport in some
petersburg relatives of those who died
will be offered counseling this man's
wife is on board he said he was on his
way to the airport when he got a call
saying the plane had crashed the first
images of the victims are beginning to
emerge there were 25 children on board
an international team of investigators
will try to find the cause of the crash
the wife of the copilot of Russian TV
he'd been worried about the technical
condition of the plane but the airline
metrojet said the plane was in good
shape and the pilot was very experienced
Andy Mohr BBC News
